contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Myślenice | image_flag = POL Myślenice flag.svg | image_shield = POL Myślenice COA.svg | image_skyline = Myslenice townhall1.jpg | image_caption = Town hall | pushpin_map = Poland | pushpin_label_position = bottom | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Lesser Poland Voivodeship|Lesser Poland]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Powiat|County]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Myślenice County]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Gmina]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Gmina Myślenice]] | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Maciej Ostrowski | area_total_km2 = 30.1 | population_as_of = 2007 | population_total = 20261 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] | utc_offset = +1 | timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] | utc_offset_DST = +2 | latd = 49 | latm = 50 | lats = | latNS = N | longd = 19 | longm = 56 | longs = | longEW = E | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 32-400 | blank_name = [[Polish car number plates|Car plates]] | blank_info = KMY | website = http://www.myslenice.pl }} '''Myślenice''' {{IPAc-pl|m|y|ś|l|e|'|ɲ|i|c|e}} is a town in southern [[Poland]], situated in the [[Lesser Poland Voivodeship]] (since 1999), previously in [[Kraków Voivodeship]] (1975–1998). Population: 20,261(2007). The town is divided into six districts. One of them, Zarabie, is a popular tourist destination. It is located behind the Raba river (hence the name), and it has Chełm mountain, with a view tower, a landscape park and [[ski lift]]s. Myślenice is located on the so-called Zakopianka Road, which is a popular name of the [[European route E77]] road, connecting [[Kraków]] with [[Zakopane]] (the E77 itself separates itself from the Zakopianka at [[Rabka]]). Myślenice does not have a train station. First mentions of Myślenice come from 1253 - 1258. At that time, it was a defensive settlement, with a castle and fortifications, designed to protect Kraków from the south. In 1342, Myślenice received its [[Magdeburg rights]] town charter, and it started to develop into a local commercial center. Among visitors who came here, were [[Mikolaj Rej]], King [[Wladyslaw Jagiello]], German emperor [[Sigismund, Holy Roman Emperor|Sigismund]], and other personalities. In 1557, Myślenice came under the jurisdiction of Kraków [[castellan]]s, who were much more concerned with their city. The town began to decline, and it was destroyed in the [[Deluge (history)|deluge]]. In 1772 (see [[Partitions of Poland]]), Myślenice was annexed by Austria, and until 1918, it belonged to the province of [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]]. After [[World War I]], the town became part of the [[Second Polish Republic]]. ==International relations== {{See also|List of twin towns and sister cities in Poland}} ===Twin towns — Sister cities=== Myślenice is [[town twinning|twinned]] with:<ref>[http://www.myslenice.pl/mieszkaniec/dla-mieszkancow/miasto/miasta-partnerskie Miasta partnerskie]</ref> * {{flagicon|POL}} [[Bełchatów]], [[Poland]] * {{flagicon|FRA}} [[Tinqueux]], [[France]] * {{flagicon|HUN}} [[Csopak]], [[Hungary]] * {{flagicon|DEU}} [[Lüdenscheid]], [[Germany]] * {{flagicon|USA}} [[Dahlonega, Georgia|Dahlonega]], [[United States]] == Sports == * [[Dalin Myślenice]] - women's [[Volleyball in Poland|volleyball]] team that has won [[Polish Seria B Women's Volleyball League]] in 2003/2004 season and was promoted to play in [[Polish Seria A Women's Volleyball League]] in 2004/2005 season. * [[Canadian Football League|CFL]] slotback [[Dave Stala]] was born here. ==External links== * [http://www.sztetl.org.pl/en/city/myslenice/ Jewish Community in Myślenice] on Virtual Shtetl ==References== {{reflist}} [[File:Myslenice sq.jpg|thumb|left|Market Square in Myślenice]] [[File:Myslenice firehouse.jpg|thumb|left|Firehouse]] {{commons category|Myślenice}} {{Myślenice County}} {{Gmina Myślenice}} {{coord|49|50|N|19|56|E|region:PL_type:city|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Myslenice}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Lesser Poland Voivodeship]] [[Category:Myślenice County]]
